main: ^My dads watching that stupid show again.
^It's a show where contestants from the Balkans come to sing, as you might have guessed from the noise.
^You could say it's like a blend of The Idol and The Voice, if you know those shows?
^The contestants can win crazy prizes, among the normal ones like an album production, song or music video, some seasons even gave the winners a car or an apartment in Belgrade.
^Have I mentioned that the show started in Belgrade?
^Have you heard of Belgrade? Do they mention the city in your history books?
^Yeah, I've been there a couple of times.

c-0: ^Well it's the capital of Serbia and also the biggest city with about 1.2 million citizens living in it.
^It's located on the rivers Sava and Danube, which also flows through Vienna. A cool thing to share with yall!
^The Kalemegdan Fortress, located in the middle of Belgrade, has been there for around 2000 years!
^It used to be the whole town, until Belgrade expanded.
^Now it's a cultural and festival center, which tourists and citizens can visit for free all year round.
^There's also this huge park called Kosutnjak Hill, where people go to recreate. On this 330 hectar park, there are lots of forests and trails to go on.
^It used to be a royal hunting reserve, but now it's used for sport and lots of filming.
c-1: ^Oh wow. That's amazing! We don't really have many "first world" citizens visit our country lol.
^Then I'm not gonna bore you with all of the facts, since you probably know a bunch.

start_game_one: ^Could you please help the singers sing well?
game_one_played: ^He's from Nis. The cultural center of Serbia.
^It houses veeeeery old archeological sites, such as Mediana, from the roman times.
^Yeah, we were conquered by the Romans way back.
^If you're into creepy and scary stuff, like my younger brother, then you'd love Cele Kula, aka the Skull Tower.
^It was built by the Ottomans after Serbian rebels detonated basically a bomb in their camp, in order to escape being impaled by the winning Ottomans.
^Quite morbid to build that tower out of your enemies, if you ask me...
^It was since been dismantled, but later restored with a chapel surrounding it.
^...aaanyways, thanks for helping my old man, cya around, kiddo!
^Hope you can sleep tonight with that tower imbedded into your brain haha...
main_two: ^This one is going to be harder than the last one. My old man was very impressed by your last performance.
^So I think you set his standards pretty high.
^Can you work your magic once more?
game_two_played: ^Wow, u really do done played that thing
^That guy was from Novi Sad. The second biggest city in Serbia.
^Since its founding, in 1694, it has (and still is) an important trading, manufacturing and cultural center.
^That's why it's been dubbed Serbian Athens.
^It is also a university town, where lots of students come to study.
^Here you can try one of the best pasulj, a typical bean stew with smoked meats like bacon and sausage.
^And kajmak, a creamy dairy food, usually served on the side, like ketchup.
^If you're more into drinking, there are a bunch of vineyards scattered across Novi Sad.
^Oh yeah right, Bosnia gave me this, could you bring it back to her?
